page.title: 02Amusement Parks in Skegness
page.content: { BUTLINS.} Before 1930 the Butlins had a fair where the County Hotel is now.Then they moved to the site of the future Bottons.They had dodgems,costa cars hooplas,helta skelta and a figure eight. Also they had a zoo, included in the zoo were monkeys,lions,parrots, a camel,a tiger,a baby elephant and many more.In 1952 there was a flood. Mr McGeachy was informed by the police that the water was 6ft deep in the park and that he was to kill the animals. {BOTTONS.} The Bottons Bros. bought the site from Butlins as they didn't want the site.This was in 1965.At that time they had 6 staff and more than 5 rides.Now in 1985 it has grown from 6 to 14 staff and from 5 rides 9.
